description: Each player can be a member of up to one 'city'
A player can found a city by placing a shrine
The player who starts a city is labelled 'king'
A king can invite new members to a city
Destroying a city shrine destroys the city
A player can leave a city
If a city owns an object, all members can use it
A player can cede an object to his city
A king can grant a city object to a player
A player can declare war on another player
Players can agree to return to peace
Two players at war with each other can fight
Players at war can destroy the other's objects
A player at war with a city can seek peace from its king
Two kings can agree to return to peace
Each player can build one 'shrine'-class object
Shrine actions require an animal carcass
Items have durability, affected by combat and use.
Objects can be repaired with specific items
Items can be repaired with specific items
A player's group shows up on the UI
Grouped players can invite others to their group
Non-grouped players can invite others to form a group
The first player to damage an NPC tags it, until it dies or disengages.
A player can be in an alternate 'instance'
Instances get static objects from templates
A player can create and enter a new instance
Instance entrance happens at a specific point in the world
Grouped players can enter the same instance
Instances are destroyed after being empty for (30m?)
There's a way to leave instances, to a specific point in the world
NPCs can specify a set of items for their image
NPCs can specify a custom human template image
A pyramid object that is unique
Players and cities can be at war with each other
Heavy items that prevent player movement
Containers may allow 'heavy' objects or not
Some tool objects have a cooldown
Make players and objects more visible on map
Sort _materials and _craftableItems by name, not ID
When a player joins a city, that city adopts his wars
Make it more obvious when something is out of range
Make client connection failures more clean
Prevent chat messages being cut off
Allow a recipe to create multiple item types
Move appropriate configuration details into config file
Players can be in a group
Stacks of the same item can be combined
A road object that affects movement speed
Containers may be restricted by item class
Use collisionRects even on non-colliding objects, for distance checks
Mouse-down events are propagating to multiple windows
Reduce calls to findUsersInArea() in NPC AI
Add esc menu to release client
Allow crafting if removing the ingredients will make room
Use gear-slot names, not numbers, in items.xml
Use exceptions to check SDL-function failures
Use forward declarations where possible, to reduce unnecessary #includes
A shrine that grants a buff
Allow tool objects to show an in-use image/animation
Use doubles, not ints, in Rect class
Remove 'can ...' tooltips when player has no permissions
Add fading unlock messages to the top of the screen
Highlight recipes/constructions that might unlock stuff
Move SDL functions and types to a namespace
Change dynamic_casts that don't check their result to static_cast or check for nullptr
Use set::count() and map::count() to test set membership
Fix ambiguity of Object::removeItem() and Object::removeItems()
Users are drawn inside (front+back) of vehicles
Memoize texture for other users' names
Remove useItem info from Container class; move it into Client object
Prevent clipping in getTileCoords() due to random coord at map edge
Calculate highlight borders by adjacency to magenta (sausage man)
Declaring war on a player in a city declares war on that city
Prevent multiple copies of sounds between SoundProfiles
Prevent users from spamming construction sites
Add toast messages for war events
Make declarations of war more fun
Make vehicle functionality a class owned by object
Server sometimes gets in infinite loop when a client disconnects
Loot random item(s?) on container destruction
Add a spectrum of container strengths
An item that damages the containing object's attacker
Interact with nearest target if none selected on interact-key
Update map pins at limited frequency, e.g., 1s
Send object-movement updates to owner and city's members
Maintain only one set of scroll-bar triangle images
Add fake latency by default, for testing
Add terrain-specific weather particles, like leaves or rain
Add gear preview to web docs
Add unlock info to web docs
Add transform images to web docs
Add recipes using the item, to web docs
Ensure fellow citizens can be seen on the map
Container slots are sometimes invisible or broken
Unowned-object colors sometimes green, sometimes grey
Make login screen behave on disconnect
Give back a small pot after constructing with a water vessel
Prevent object updates from interrupting crafting
Prevent passive selection from interrupting crafting
NPCs are never culled once discovered
Objects are not culled on respawn/teleport
Fix disappearing tooltips; appears to get worse over time
'Too far away to perform that action' spam
Create different tool name for pottery
Non-killers alerted to loot are not alerted to no loot
Stop 'Action interrupted' when spamming right-click on an NPC
Add recipe for water vessel -> small pot
Trade is blocked if inventory is full but result would fit
Space check on trade doesn't account for existing stacks
Space check on trade doesn't account for items' stack size
Limit ware selection to items in container
Don't require 'set' button for trade slots
find-item search doesn't work for more than 1 character
Avoid window overlap if possible, for object windows
Add container contents to object tooltips
Under-construction objects get full loot on destruction
Under-construction objects can't be looted on destruction
Make allowed-terrain more intuitive for construction
Give ovens a fueled state, and remove fuel from recipes
Make players more clear on map
Show time remaining until objects transform
Can't build an altar if I have a zero-health one
Make object health and respawn timers persistent
Display names with first letter capitalised
A 'fireball' command that damages target by constant
Fireball damage modified by magic-damage stat
Buffs can be cast on target (no longer random)
Buffs can be restricted to self
Spell to summon a friendly NPC
Spells must be learned, with commands
A window with buttons to learn spells
Learning spells can require a tool
On death, lose a leaf skill
On death, drop part of a leaf spell's cost
An options window and checkbox to automatically re-learn skills
Skill tree can include passive stats
Non-ranged damage can be blocked (reduced by k)
NPCs have threat tables to dictate target
A buff to take damage for target
Spells to cure curse, sleep, stun, fear
An object that gives nearby players a buff
A spell that does extra threat
